title: Installation
content:
How to work with JSON Blog JBLOG

We make it 3 versions, Static HTML Version, Node Version, and PHP version, you can choose it according to your needs in developing the project.

Click Next Pagination to see next documentation

title: JBlog Node Version
content:
JBLog Node JS Version Installation

For Node Js you can open terminal and run this command 

npx jblog-x

If you want to install with your project name you can run 
npx jblog-x myproject

Next step you can access your project folder and run this command 

cd myproject && npm run build && npm start

Open localhost:7000 on your web browser.

Make sure after you have update your project run 

npm run build
and next you can run built version via 
npm run server

title: JBlog PHP Version
description: How to install JSON Blog JBLOG Project PHP version
content:
How to work and install JSON Blog JBLOG PHP Version

For PHP version you can use JBlog PHP Version , create new project folder in to xampp/htdocs folder ,

Run your web server LAMPP , WAMPP , XAMPP etc, and access your project

Download JBlog PHP version and upload in to your host or in to your htdocs

Download JBlog Now

title: JBLOG Static HTML
content:
JBLog HTML Stactic Version

If you want to use static HTML, then JBlog HTML is the best choice for you.

You can download the static HTML version directly. then upload in to your hosting.
Download HTML Version

title: JBlog Configuration
description: First setup your JSON Blog Project
content:
Configuration and Setup JSON Blog JBLOG

Before starting blogging, you can set up your site, to update the navbar menu, number of blog posts, and various other needs.

Access the data folder, then open the config.json file, then change the site name to match your site name, default image for Twitter card and opengraph image needs, then menu navigation, and the number of posts to be displayed on your blog list.

Next you can access on src/index.js for node version - then update in this line code 

function updateCanonicalLink(url) {
document.getElementById('canonicalLink').setAttribute('href', `https://yourdomainhere.com${url}`);
}

Change domain with your domain for canoncial SEO Needs

title: Update Home Page
description: How to update homr page JSON Blog JBlog Project
content:
Home Page Update JSON Blog JBLOG

To start, we can update the home page, you can access the data folder, and open the home.json file, then change it according to your needs there. such as changing the title, description, and content of the article.

title: Static Page
description: How to Create new static page JBLOG Project
content:
How to Create new static page JBLOG Project

This project also provides static pages, which makes it easier for you to create static pages, such as about, contact and others.

To create a new static page, you simply create a new json file and save it in the folder, data, make sure to follow the existing format. 

 'title': 'Yout tite here', 
'description; 'description goes here..',
'content': 'yourcontent.. you can also use html code'

After creating a static page, you can integrate it with the navbar menu to access your static page. To edit and update a static page, simply select which static page file you want to change.

title: Blog Post
description: How to create and update blog post JSON Blog JBLOG Project
content:
How to create and update blog post JSON Blog JBLOG Project

After making the settings and creating a static page, you are now ready to create an article blog.

Access to data/blog.json there you can open the file, and then start to create an article, make sure the ID is sequential to make it easier for you, then fill in the title, description, and enter the article content, in the article content you can also embed the HTML code there.

title: Deploy to Node Server
description: You can run your JBlog JSON Blog project in to Node Host
content:
Run and Deploy in to Node js Host

Make sure you use JBLOG Node version.,To run into Node Js server, you can simply create a new node js app, next you can input start with npm start, then start your node application.

title: Deploy to Static Host
description: How to run on Jblog in to static host
content:
Run and Deploy in to Static Host

Make sure you use JBLOG Node version.,To run into Static Modern Host server such vercel, netlify, or cloudflare, you can push your project in to your github repo, then integrate with netlify and deploy it, in build command you can input npm run build, and for build prodcution you can input dist folder..

title: Deploy to PHP Host
description: How to run JBLOG Json Blog Project in to PHP host
content:
How to run JBLOG Json Blog Project in to PHP host

To run and deploy in to PHP hosting , you can use JBlog PHP version or Jblog Static HTML version, just upload in to your project, and your site is live
